text: Walter W. Hackett (c. 1923 – April 24, 1971) was an American football coach. He served as the defensive line coach for the San Diego Chargers of the American Football League (AFL) from 1962 to 1966 and the Pittsburgh Steelers of the National Football League (NFL) from 1969 to 1970. Hackett was the head football coach at the University of California, San Diego during that school's lone season with a football program, in 1968. Hackett attended Ramona High School in Ramona, California, where he played high school football. He played four years of college football at Whittier College in Whittier, California under head coach Wallace Newman. Hackett died at the age of 47, on April 24, 1971, in Long Beach, California, after collapsing as he prepared to scout the Long Beach State football team. ==References== Category:Year of birth missing Category:1920s births Category:1971 deaths Category:American football tackles Category:Baylor Bears football coaches Category:Pittsburgh Steelers coaches Category:San Diego Chargers coaches Category:UC San Diego Tritons football coaches Category:Whittier Poets football players Category:High school football coaches in California Category:Junior college football coaches in the United States Category:People from Tuscola, Illinois Category:People from Ramona, California Category:Sportspeople from San Diego County, California Category:Players of American football from California
title: Walt Hackett
